intro: Knautia ochroleuca, commonly known as the white knautia, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny grasslands and rocky soils, preferring well-drained conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often reddish in color. Knautia ochroleuca is a perennial herb that blooms from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
